intro: Utania racemosa, commonly known as the clustered utania, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are covered in fine, soft hairs. Utania racemosa is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
